title: Consider dropping .NET Standard 1.3 support.
body:
.NET Standard 1.3 is an ancient TFM and all the frameworks it supports and .NET Standard 2.0 doesn't, are legacy (with the exception of UWP earlier than 10.0.16299, ~~which might matter if you want to support LTSC versions of Windows 10~~ no it doesn't, you target UWP explicitly).

To ease maintainability and enable newer framework features without `#ifdef`s, you should consider dropping support for .NET Standard 1.3 in SkiaSharp.
